result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony P Panella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to and AODA Assessment and follow through with treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random drug screens.
Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.
No contact with Ashley T.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars or liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Cases 14CF788, 14CF751 and 14CM1315 were dismissed and read into: 14CF752 and 14CF825.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

7/28/2017 - COURT GRANTS REQUEST OF 173 DAYS OF SENTENCE CREDIT.

12/18/2017 - PER STATE'S REQUEST, COURT AMENDS SENTENCE CREDIT ON 17CF117 FROM 130 DAYS TO 100 DAYS OF CREDIT AND AMENDS THE SENTENCE CREDIT ON 14CF825 FROM 173 DAYS TO 30 DAYS OF CREDIT. 

2/6/2018 - AFTER REVIEW, COURT AMENDS JOC AND GRANTS 130 DAYS OF SENTENCE CREDIT ONTO CASE 14CF825.

04/18/2018 - PER REVIEW HEARING, COURT GRANTS 203 DAYS TOTAL SENTENCE CREDIT.
Concurrent with: Count #1 in 14CF752
Consecutive to: Count #2 in 14CF752

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Previously ordered costs/fees to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

superTimeConds.notes: Perform a TOTAL of 200 hours of Community Service as a condition of extended supervision on this case and as a condition of probation on 17CF117.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court adjourns the revocation hearing and schedules the revocation cases to tag along with the new case only for the March 29, 2017 date.  Hearing scheduled for March 29, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation - concurrent to 14CF752
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Random drug screens.   Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent. No contact with Ashley T.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  DNA Sample if not yet provided.

Expungement addressed. 
State argues against expungement
Court does not think expungement is appropriate
